intro: Wibelia graveolens, commonly known as the stinking balm, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to reddish flowers. The plant has a strong, unpleasant odor, which is likely a defense mechanism against herbivores. Wibelia graveolens typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used by indigenous peoples for various health purposes.
